entities.name: COMMERCIAL PAPER
entities.description: Commercial paper is a short-term debt instrument issued by corporations.

entities.name: CERTIFICATES OF DEPOSIT
entities.description: Certificates of deposit are savings certificates with a fixed maturity date and specified fixed interest rate.

entities.name: U.S. GOVERNMENT SECURITIES
entities.description: U.S. government securities are debt instruments issued by the U.S. Department of the Treasury to finance government spending.

entities.name: U.S. AGENCY SECURITIES
entities.description: U.S. agency securities are bonds and notes issued by U.S. government-sponsored enterprises.

entities.name: FOREIGN GOVERNMENT BONDS
entities.description: Foreign government bonds are debt securities issued by foreign governments.

entities.name: MORTGAGE- AND ASSET-BACKED SECURITIES
entities.description: Mortgage- and asset-backed securities are debt instruments backed by mortgage loans or other financial assets.

entities.name: CORPORATE NOTES AND BONDS
entities.description: Corporate notes and bonds are debt securities issued by corporations to raise capital.

entities.name: MUNICIPAL SECURITIES
entities.description: Municipal securities are debt instruments issued by local governments or their agencies.

entities.name: DERIVATIVES
entities.description: Derivatives are financial contracts whose value is derived from the performance of underlying assets, indexes, or interest rates.

relationships.relationship_description: Both are short-term debt instruments used by corporations and financial institutions.
Both are debt instruments issued by U.S. government entities.
Both are debt instruments issued by non-governmental and governmental entities respectively.
Both are financial instruments derived from underlying assets.
Both are government-issued debt instruments but from different countries.
